intro: Hypocalymma suavis, commonly known as the sweet hypocalymma, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters during spring. Its leaves are narrow and leathery, adapted to conserve water in its harsh environment. Hypocalymma suavis is often found in rocky soils and is a component of the local flora in South Australia and Western Australia.
